page.title: 01Cockerham sands & salt marsh
page.content: This is an important ecological area, a part of Morecambe Bay,and an ever changing world of sand and water, continually being shaped by the ebb and flow of the twice daily tides. The bed of the bay is mainly sand and silt,with nearer to the sea wall,salt marsh cut by gullies and channels.The area between the new sea wall and the A588 road has been reclaimed for farming. Although the area reclaimed is only about eight per cent of the block, it would be expected to have some effect on the ecology of the area. Thousands of gulls,terns, wildfowl and waders are drawn to the area to feed and roost.Controlled shooting,a pinic area in the reclaimed area and caravan sites on the North East corner,with watersports facilities, provide leisure activities for urban dwellers.
